interestingcomments.content:
Is an A6100 with a zoom lens enough for a safari? /!/ Hey there! I have a trip planned later this year to go on a wildlife safari in Africa. I’ve never really been into photography, but I figured this is a trip as good as any to learn!

I wanted to get a good entry level camera and seemed to set my sights on the a6100 which has everything I think I’d need. I was originally thinking of just getting it with the kit lens to practice for a few months, but I’d also like to rent a nice lens like the 70-350mm or 200-600mm for the trip.

I’m planning on taking pictures on my trip and then blowing them up and framing them in my office, but I was wondering if there was another other camera or lens combo that you all would recommend for this type of trip. Thanks!

interestingcomments.content:
Best Camera for a road trip and beyond? /!/ Hey Y'all.

I have the fortunate and beautiful opportunity to do a road trip from San Antonio, Texas all the way up to Bend, Oregon(Central Oregon) and all the way back! I plan on making a lot of stops at national parks and other beautiful places along the way. Most of my stops will be geared towards nature as thats my main motivation for the trip.

Now, a challenge of planning this road trip is also capturing it and I need a good camera to do so. 

I have beginner level experience with cameras although this will be my first time owning one. I would prefer a camera in the $400 range(I am hoping to buy used to save money).

After the road trip I plan on further utilizing the camera and learning more technical skills as I go. 

&#x200B;

All suggestions and advice is greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!
